Tony: Generally, it’s to avoid confronting the very real and difficult...

Tony: Generally, it’s to avoid confronting the very real and difficult issues that most proper adults have to deal with.

summary: Cool Off
title: Cool Off
body:
Pairing: Tony Stark x reader

Warnings: jealousy

Summary: [the request itself] Hey! Could you write “you’re realising you’re talking to my girl, right??” With Tony Stark? Thanks

—

Tony rarely got jealous, he had no reason to be, he knew you were his, and he knew he could trust you, but when he caught an old friend of yours talking to you and flirting with you, he couldn’t help but to clench his jaw and walk over, wrapping a possessive arm around your waist and pulling you as close as he could. 

“You realise you’re talking to my girl, right?” Tony asked of your friend, whose eyes widened as they swallowed thickly; Tony’s presence was always intimidating when it came to people who were trying to flirt with you, as they knew they could never compete with the handsome, genius, hero, which explained why your friend started to stutter and look nervous. 

“Listen, I, uh-” they looked between you and Tony quickly and with guilt before looking away. “I best get going…” 

When they were long gone, you turned to Tony, and frowned. “Really, Tone?”

He smirked and shrugged. “What? All I said was that you were my girl, baby.” 

You rolled your eyes, letting a chuckle fall from your lips. “Y’know, I really can’t get mad when it’s so hot when you get jealous.” 

“You think it’s hot when I get jealous?” He asked lowly, pulling you in front of him and biting his lip when you nodded and admitted that you did. “How about we go home, and cool off?”

summary: I wonder what's it like at 4 am on the very top of the stark tower. I mean, that's the time when it's usually too late to be...
body:
I wonder what’s it like at 4 am on the very top of the stark tower. I mean, that’s the time when it’s usually too late to be still awake, but also too early to be already up. It’s when you feel old and powerful but also tiny and naive, watching the sun rise or the stars begin to fade slowly. It’s the modern witching hour.

And I bet it’s beautiful, from up there.

Sadly enough, I think Tony could easily answer that question.

summary:
steve and tony, why their mutual respect is essential to the avengers.
the thing about the avengers, is that steve and tony...
body:
steve and tony, why their mutual respect is essential to the avengers.

the thing about the avengers, is that steve and tony truly are the core. they’re both the closest to ‘normal’ on the team, they’re both leaders, without both of them, the avengers aren’t the avengers. 

in the avengers, they make judgements on each other, tony from what he’s been told growing up completely contradicting what steve rogers turn out to be and steve, presumably, was only shown his file, which we know said ’textbook narcissism’ and then prove each other wrong throughout the film.

tony calls steve ‘not of use’ and then relies on him in the battle at the end to take charge. we can also infer that tony’s completely disappointed that his hero’s not all that he’s cracked up to be in that first helicarrier scene, but in that final scene with loki, he tells him that he’s a ‘living legend that kind of lives up to the legend’ - tony lost and then regained respect for him, for him, the legends were right.

steve tells tony that he ‘only fights for himself’, as a result of the file he’s seen on him. tony flies a nuke into a wormhole to save new york, near enough exactly what steve did at the end of the first avenger. through this, steve also gains respect for tony, he sees that he was wrong. 

we end with them shaking hands and going their separate ways - maybe not quite friends yet, but on the path, and they respect each other. they won

in the opening of age of ultron, we see them fighting together, this is probably their ‘peak’ if it were, they’re fighting as a team, seamlessly, there’s more than respect now, there’s trust, you watch that scene back again, you can tell, they’re close enough that they can joke while they’re fighting steve isn’t afraid to call tony out (language) and he just makes light of it, when in the avengers, he likely would’ve insulted him.

there’s a scene with them partying, comfortable around one another, they all try to pick up mjolnir, essentially another dick-measuring contest but it’s light-hearted fun, they’re friends

tony, a guy, who’s established as a little of a control-freak gives up power to steve, whilst also establishing that both of them are leaders, in the interaction between hill and tony (h: boss? t: nah, [steve]’s the boss, i just pay for everything and make everyone look cool), this shows trust and that they’re an established team, but also small insecurities as steve looks surprised that tony’d said that.

age of ultron is also where we see more cracks forming in their relationship, they’re keeping secrets from one another, tony with ultron and steve with his parents’ death (dealt with in civil war)

that wood chopping scene details it. steve’s just come back from tearing down hydra and shield, ultron, from his perspective, would have sounded a lot like project insight - something he was vehemently against, something almost lost his life, and sam and nat’s, destroying. 

in this, they’re showing more than just a ‘who’s better’ type of argument like the helicarrier one from the avengers, they’re showing their opposing ideologies in protecting their world, in how they do their jobs, based on their previous experience.

tony’s trying to win a war before it starts, so to speak, because he used to be a war profiteer, to him, if he hadn’t sold those weapons in the first place, there would have bee less damage, he saw what effect his weapons were having, and to some extent, he believes that those lives lost were his fault, my weapons.

steve knows that every time someone tries to win a war before it starts, people get hurt, maybe because he thinks that war is inevitable, regardless of what people do beforehand that may win it, because people get hurt from that. he saw that with erskine, right after he got the serum, to him, war stays on the battlefield, extending it past that, with espionage, is how people get hurt.

it’s also a callback to project insight, innocent people were targetted, he doesn’t want that to happen again.

whilst they both have different ways on how they should do it, their main missions are to protect the innocent and avenge those they couldn’t, tony pretty much says it in the avengers.

we end this one with them friendly, freinds, close, they both open up to each other about their prospective futures, possible families. steve does have a friend, maybe almost a mentor in tony - i’ll miss you tony -  tony tells him, you’ll get there someday, in reference to family/stability, he gives him reassurance, tony asks him you alright, both of these lines show that he cares for steve and that steve trusts him enough to open up a little about it (guy that wanted that went in the ice 75 years ago, i think someone else came out) 

at the end of age of ultron they trust each other. they win

which just makes civil war all the more angstier, the avengers break up, because that trust between steve and tony is completely shattered. the consequences of sokovia alongside the guilt tony carries (ultron, my fault), which has been a thematic part of his character ever since iron man, put him on the side of the accords whilst steve’s arc leads him on the other, him drawing on his previous experience with governmental oversight, puts him against the accords.

their argument in the conference room highlights their opposing viewpoints, beautifully illustrates their relationship so far and for the rest of the movie, it’s not the breaking point, as such, but it is a turning point.

sometimes i wanna punch you in your perfect teeth, but i don’t want to see you gone

tony extends an olive branch in the form of the lend-lease pens, he doesn’t want the avengers to break up, but steve foreshadows their conversation and the third act, some would say it brought our country closer to war, he’s telling tony that, whilst he recognises his view and why he’s for the accords, that the accords will tear the avengers apart. tony tells him that he wouldn’t be here without them and steve deflects and asks about pepper, tony indulges him and opens up about his relationship and their taking a break, tony tells him that he doesn’t want to stop being iron man, he explains why his signing on to the accords throughout that part of the conversation, it seems like they’re getting closer to reconciliation, steve’s a hair’s breadth from signing, until they mention protection, which steve interprets as internment, going back to what he almost lost his life destroying with project insight.

tony sees a weapon of mass destruction in wanda, he wants to protect as many people as possible, including her, steve sees a kid, he’s always been one to look out for the little guy.

tony yells at him to give [him] a break, he’s stressed and he’s scared, he doesn’t want to fall out with steve, he doesn’t want the avengers to break up.

the next turning point is just before they all start fighting in the airport, their resentment has grown to a point of blaming each other for the avengers splitting up, there’s a tiny, tiny hope that they may still be together, but that’s obliterated pretty fast.

the true moment beyond repair, for their relationship is, t: don’t bullshit me rogers, did you know s: yes. their trust is completely gone, they’re no longer friends, to tony, steve’s made his choice, not him or the avengers, and steve’s made a mistake, he regrets not telling tony.

they fight. tony is clearly blinded by his emotions, he wants to kill barnes, steve won’t let him, barnes is his friend and he won’t let tony have that guilt as well. steve disables his suit, tony confirms that their friendship is over.

alongside that, steve drops his shield, he’s no longer captain america, he’s a fugitive.

steve extends an olive branch in the form of the letter, he explains his regrets, and he ends with if you need me, i’ll be there. he knows that they likely won’t be what they were again, but he knows that what the avengers do is bigger than them.

steve’s made mistakes and the phone and the letter is the only way he knows that tony will accept. it’s not exactly reconciliation, but it’s close.

the avengers fall apart and the villian gets what he wanted. for all intents and purposes, they’ve lost.

tony, as far as we know, never calls steve, the only time he even thinks about it is in infinity war, but he still keeps a prototype of steve’s shield in the tower. but he does keep that phone with him at all times, thanos is coming and tony’s about to call steve, but he doesn’t get a chance. he isn’t over what happened, but he needed him.

steve’s been living the past two years as a vigilante, as nomad, the man without a country, he grew a depression beard as a result of civil war, he’s completely separated himself from the avengers, he’s torn the avengers badge off his uniform, but when he thinks that tony’s dead, he’s ready to avenge him, earth just lost her best defender he goes against ross again, i’m not asking for forgiveness, and i’m way past asking permission, nothing will stop him from avenging tony’s ‘death’.

the avengers aren’t together, as a result of steve and tony not being together. they lose. they’ve lost in a way they’ve never had before.

we don’t know what’s going to happen in endgame, but based on everything else, we know that for them to win, to defeat thanos, they avengers have to be together, and for the avengers to be together, steve and tony have to, at the very least, respect each other.

in the opening of age of ultron, we see them fighting together, this is probably their ‘peak’ if it were, they’re fighting as a team, seamlessly, there’s more than respect now, there’s trust, you watch that scene back again, you can tell, they’re close enough that they can joke while they’re fighting steve isn’t afraid to call tony out (language) and he just makes light of it, when in the avengers, he likely would’ve insulted him.

there’s a scene with them partying, comfortable around one another, they all try to pick up mjolnir, essentially another dick-measuring contest but it’s light-hearted fun, they’re friends

tony, a guy, who’s established as a little of a control-freak gives up power to steve, whilst also establishing that both of them are leaders, in the interaction between hill and tony (h: boss? t: nah, [steve]’s the boss, i just pay for everything and make everyone look cool), this shows trust and that they’re an established team, but also small insecurities as steve looks surprised that tony’d said that.

age of ultron is also where we see more cracks forming in their relationship, they’re keeping secrets from one another, tony with ultron and steve with his parents’ death (dealt with in civil war)

that wood chopping scene details it. steve’s just come back from tearing down hydra and shield, ultron, from his perspective, would have sounded a lot like project insight - something he was vehemently against, something almost lost his life, and sam and nat’s, destroying. 

in this, they’re showing more than just a ‘who’s better’ type of argument like the helicarrier one from the avengers, they’re showing their opposing ideologies in protecting their world, in how they do their jobs, based on their previous experience.

tony’s trying to win a war before it starts, so to speak, because he used to be a war profiteer, to him, if he hadn’t sold those weapons in the first place, there would have bee less damage, he saw what effect his weapons were having, and to some extent, he believes that those lives lost were his fault, my weapons.

steve knows that every time someone tries to win a war before it starts, people get hurt, maybe because he thinks that war is inevitable, regardless of what people do beforehand that may win it, because people get hurt from that. he saw that with erskine, right after he got the serum, to him, war stays on the battlefield, extending it past that, with espionage, is how people get hurt.

it’s also a callback to project insight, innocent people were targetted, he doesn’t want that to happen again.

whilst they both have different ways on how they should do it, their main missions are to protect the innocent and avenge those they couldn’t, tony pretty much says it in the avengers.

we end this one with them friendly, freinds, close, they both open up to each other about their prospective futures, possible families. steve does have a friend, maybe almost a mentor in tony - i’ll miss you tony -  tony tells him, you’ll get there someday, in reference to family/stability, he gives him reassurance, tony asks him you alright, both of these lines show that he cares for steve and that steve trusts him enough to open up a little about it (guy that wanted that went in the ice 75 years ago, i think someone else came out) 

at the end of age of ultron they trust each other. they win

which just makes civil war all the more angstier, the avengers break up, because that trust between steve and tony is completely shattered. the consequences of sokovia alongside the guilt tony carries (ultron, my fault), which has been a thematic part of his character ever since iron man, put him on the side of the accords whilst steve’s arc leads him on the other, him drawing on his previous experience with governmental oversight, puts him against the accords.

their argument in the conference room highlights their opposing viewpoints, beautifully illustrates their relationship so far and for the rest of the movie, it’s not the breaking point, as such, but it is a turning point.

sometimes i wanna punch you in your perfect teeth, but i don’t want to see you gone

tony extends an olive branch in the form of the lend-lease pens, he doesn’t want the avengers to break up, but steve foreshadows their conversation and the third act, some would say it brought our country closer to war, he’s telling tony that, whilst he recognises his view and why he’s for the accords, that the accords will tear the avengers apart. tony tells him that he wouldn’t be here without them and steve deflects and asks about pepper, tony indulges him and opens up about his relationship and their taking a break, tony tells him that he doesn’t want to stop being iron man, he explains why his signing on to the accords throughout that part of the conversation, it seems like they’re getting closer to reconciliation, steve’s a hair’s breadth from signing, until they mention protection, which steve interprets as internment, going back to what he almost lost his life destroying with project insight.

tony sees a weapon of mass destruction in wanda, he wants to protect as many people as possible, including her, steve sees a kid, he’s always been one to look out for the little guy.

tony yells at him to give [him] a break, he’s stressed and he’s scared, he doesn’t want to fall out with steve, he doesn’t want the avengers to break up.

the next turning point is just before they all start fighting in the airport, their resentment has grown to a point of blaming each other for the avengers splitting up, there’s a tiny, tiny hope that they may still be together, but that’s obliterated pretty fast.

the true moment beyond repair, for their relationship is, t: don’t bullshit me rogers, did you know s: yes. their trust is completely gone, they’re no longer friends, to tony, steve’s made his choice, not him or the avengers, and steve’s made a mistake, he regrets not telling tony.

they fight. tony is clearly blinded by his emotions, he wants to kill barnes, steve won’t let him, barnes is his friend and he won’t let tony have that guilt as well. steve disables his suit, tony confirms that their friendship is over.

alongside that, steve drops his shield, he’s no longer captain america, he’s a fugitive.

steve extends an olive branch in the form of the letter, he explains his regrets, and he ends with if you need me, i’ll be there. he knows that they likely won’t be what they were again, but he knows that what the avengers do is bigger than them.

steve’s made mistakes and the phone and the letter is the only way he knows that tony will accept. it’s not exactly reconciliation, but it’s close.

the avengers fall apart and the villian gets what he wanted. for all intents and purposes, they’ve lost.

tony, as far as we know, never calls steve, the only time he even thinks about it is in infinity war, but he still keeps a prototype of steve’s shield in the tower. but he does keep that phone with him at all times, thanos is coming and tony’s about to call steve, but he doesn’t get a chance. he isn’t over what happened, but he needed him.

steve’s been living the past two years as a vigilante, as nomad, the man without a country, he grew a depression beard as a result of civil war, he’s completely separated himself from the avengers, he’s torn the avengers badge off his uniform, but when he thinks that tony’s dead, he’s ready to avenge him, earth just lost her best defender he goes against ross again, i’m not asking for forgiveness, and i’m way past asking permission, nothing will stop him from avenging tony’s ‘death’.

the avengers aren’t together, as a result of steve and tony not being together. they lose. they’ve lost in a way they’ve never had before.

we don’t know what’s going to happen in endgame, but based on everything else, we know that for them to win, to defeat thanos, they avengers have to be together, and for the avengers to be together, steve and tony have to, at the very least, respect each other.
trail.content:
steve and tony, why their mutual respect is essential to the avengers.

summary: Remembering hurts || 4 Prolouge | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 "Y/n? What the hell are you doing" Tony exclaims with wide eyes. "Nothing"...
body:
Remembering hurts || 4

Prolouge | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5

“Y/n? What the hell are you doing” Tony exclaims with wide eyes. “Nothing” she quickly removes her costume and is back in her own clothes. “You you just transformed” he points at her. “What are you talking about Tony?”

One of the only plus sides of her old life is that she knows how to lie. She has done it a lot in Asgard. “You were wearing like an armor and doing weird magic stuff” he points at her. “Tony calm down, I think you’ve had some weird hallucination it can happen when you sleep little. Just go to bed and it’ll be okay” y/n knows it’s bad to lie, but she knows that he will declare her for crazy if she says the truth.

“oh okay sure” Tony slowly lies down in y/n’s bed. “Get some sleep” she strokes his head.

“Come come” Tony shuffles over to the side of the bed. “Tony I can’t” y/n shakes her head lightly. “whyy” he whines in his sleepy state. “I- I can’t Tony” y/n tries to walk away bit Tony grabs her wrist. “Please just come” the goddess hears the pleads and she wonders why he would sleep around if it made him so lonely.

“Only because it’s you” y/n gives in with a small smile and lies down next to the billionaire. “Thank you” Tony mumbles as he snuggles in his assistant.

The second time in two days that they sleep together. They both know that that’s not something a boss and his employee does but they don’t care as it was most comfortable in each others arms.

The night ended soon and they act like nothing happend. Like they didn’t just slept two nights in each others arms.

“Tony where are you? It’s about to start” y/n leaves an angry message in his voicemail.

“ Visionary. Genius. American patriot.” the presentation starts. “Even from an early age, the son of legendary weapons developer Howard Stark quickly stole the spotlight with his brilliant and unique mind. At age four, he built his first circuit board. At age six, his first engine. And at seventeen, he graduated Summa Cum Laude from MIT.”

“Then, the passing of a titan. Howard Stark’s life long friend and ally Obadiah Stane, steps in to help fill the gap left by the legendary founder. Untill at age 21, the prodigal son returns, and is anointed the new CEO of Stark Industries”

“With the keys to the kingdom, Tony ushers in a new era for his father’s legacy, creating smarter weapons, advanced robotics”

“As liaison to Stark Industries, I’ve had the unique privilege of serving with a real patriot. He is my friend and he is my great mentor. Ladies and gentlemen, it is my honor to present this year’s Apogee Award to Mr. Tony Stark!” Rhodey says taking over from the pre-programmed show.

“Tony?” Rhodey look through the room, his gaze falls on the goddess and y/n slightly shakes her head. Everyone starts mumbling things about Tony. Y/n looks at Obadiah signaling him to go on the stage.

He gets the idea and awkwardly stumbles on the stage. “Thank you…I, uhhh, I’m not Tony Stark, but if I were Tony, I’d tell you how honored I am and…what a joy it is to receive this award. The best thing about Tony is also the worst thing – he’s always working” Obadiah says rounds of his speech and walks down the stairs. He angrily shoves the award in y/n’s hands and says “Get this to Tony and talk to him about this”

She rolls her eyes and walks towards the one place Tony Stark would be, the casino.

“C’mon” Tony mutters before he throws the dice on the table. “Tony” y/n says to get his attention. “Ah there is my lucky charm” Tony pulls her closer but she worms out of his grip. “What’s wrong?” he tilts his head slightly.

“They said if I would presented you with an award you would be deeply honored” Rhodey says. “Of course I’d be deeply honored” Tony defends him. “So when do we do it?” he asks them. “It’s over already” y/n rolls her eyes. Tony continues to roll the dice and he even asks for y/n and Rhodey to blow in his hand for luck, they both decline.

“Mr. Stark excuse me, Christine Everheart” a girl introduces herself. ‘One of those one night stands’ y/n thinks to herself. “Can I ask you a couple of questions?” she asks, but Tony is to busy talking to Happy about how cute she is. “Yeah okay go” Tony turns back to the girl.

“You’ve been called the DaVinci of out time. What do you say to that?” Christine asks. “Ridiculous I don’t paint” Tony answers quickly. “And what about your other nickname the merchant of death?” she continues. “That’s not that bad” Tony says.

“Let me guess Berkley” Tony says trying to seduce the woman. “No Brown actually” she corrects him. “Well miss Brown. It’s an imperfect world, but it’s the only one we’ve got. I guarantee you the day weapons are no longer needed to keep the peace, we’ll start making bricks and beams for baby hospitals.” Tony uses his speech.

“Rehearse that much?” Christine tries to be quick witted and shame Tony, but they’re talking about a man who knows no shame. “Every night in front if the mirror” he says with his all famous smirk on his face.

“I can see that” she flirts. “I’d like to show you first hand”

“All I want is a serious answer” Christine suddenly changes to professional and so does Tony. “Okay, here is serious. My old man had a philosophy: ‘Peace means having a bigger stick than the other guy.’” Tony says, his father will always be a difficult topic for the playboy. “That’s a great line from the guy selling the sticks” Christine smiles like she’s better than everyone around her.

“My father helped defeat Nazis. He worked on the Manhattan Project. A lot of people, including your professors at Brown, would call that being a hero.” Tony says a bit harsh. “A lot of people would also call it war profiting” Christine replies.

Y/n, being a bit done with the same discussion that’ll end in a one night stand, decides to call a cab and go home.

“I’m going see you tomorrow” she whispers to Happy, not wanting to break up the little fight between Christine and Tony. “See you tomorrow” he whispers back.

Y/n enters the taxi and goes straight home. Tomorrow they’ll be going to Afghanistan and she still has to pack for herself and Tony.

The night ended soon and they act like nothing happend. Like they didn’t just slept two nights in each others arms.

“Tony where are you? It’s about to start” y/n leaves an angry message in his voicemail.

“ Visionary. Genius. American patriot.” the presentation starts. “Even from an early age, the son of legendary weapons developer Howard Stark quickly stole the spotlight with his brilliant and unique mind. At age four, he built his first circuit board. At age six, his first engine. And at seventeen, he graduated Summa Cum Laude from MIT.”

“Then, the passing of a titan. Howard Stark’s life long friend and ally Obadiah Stane, steps in to help fill the gap left by the legendary founder. Untill at age 21, the prodigal son returns, and is anointed the new CEO of Stark Industries”

“With the keys to the kingdom, Tony ushers in a new era for his father’s legacy, creating smarter weapons, advanced robotics”

“As liaison to Stark Industries, I’ve had the unique privilege of serving with a real patriot. He is my friend and he is my great mentor. Ladies and gentlemen, it is my honor to present this year’s Apogee Award to Mr. Tony Stark!” Rhodey says taking over from the pre-programmed show.

“Tony?” Rhodey look through the room, his gaze falls on the goddess and y/n slightly shakes her head. Everyone starts mumbling things about Tony. Y/n looks at Obadiah signaling him to go on the stage.

He gets the idea and awkwardly stumbles on the stage. “Thank you…I, uhhh, I’m not Tony Stark, but if I were Tony, I’d tell you how honored I am and…what a joy it is to receive this award. The best thing about Tony is also the worst thing – he’s always working” Obadiah says rounds of his speech and walks down the stairs. He angrily shoves the award in y/n’s hands and says “Get this to Tony and talk to him about this”

She rolls her eyes and walks towards the one place Tony Stark would be, the casino.

“C’mon” Tony mutters before he throws the dice on the table. “Tony” y/n says to get his attention. “Ah there is my lucky charm” Tony pulls her closer but she worms out of his grip. “What’s wrong?” he tilts his head slightly.

“They said if I would presented you with an award you would be deeply honored” Rhodey says. “Of course I’d be deeply honored” Tony defends him. “So when do we do it?” he asks them. “It’s over already” y/n rolls her eyes. Tony continues to roll the dice and he even asks for y/n and Rhodey to blow in his hand for luck, they both decline.

“Mr. Stark excuse me, Christine Everheart” a girl introduces herself. ‘One of those one night stands’ y/n thinks to herself. “Can I ask you a couple of questions?” she asks, but Tony is to busy talking to Happy about how cute she is. “Yeah okay go” Tony turns back to the girl.

“You’ve been called the DaVinci of out time. What do you say to that?” Christine asks. “Ridiculous I don’t paint” Tony answers quickly. “And what about your other nickname the merchant of death?” she continues. “That’s not that bad” Tony says.

“Let me guess Berkley” Tony says trying to seduce the woman. “No Brown actually” she corrects him. “Well miss Brown. It’s an imperfect world, but it’s the only one we’ve got. I guarantee you the day weapons are no longer needed to keep the peace, we’ll start making bricks and beams for baby hospitals.” Tony uses his speech.

“Rehearse that much?” Christine tries to be quick witted and shame Tony, but they’re talking about a man who knows no shame. “Every night in front if the mirror” he says with his all famous smirk on his face.

“I can see that” she flirts. “I’d like to show you first hand”

“All I want is a serious answer” Christine suddenly changes to professional and so does Tony. “Okay, here is serious. My old man had a philosophy: ‘Peace means having a bigger stick than the other guy.’” Tony says, his father will always be a difficult topic for the playboy. “That’s a great line from the guy selling the sticks” Christine smiles like she’s better than everyone around her.

“My father helped defeat Nazis. He worked on the Manhattan Project. A lot of people, including your professors at Brown, would call that being a hero.” Tony says a bit harsh. “A lot of people would also call it war profiting” Christine replies.

Y/n, being a bit done with the same discussion that’ll end in a one night stand, decides to call a cab and go home.

“I’m going see you tomorrow” she whispers to Happy, not wanting to break up the little fight between Christine and Tony. “See you tomorrow” he whispers back.

Y/n enters the taxi and goes straight home. Tomorrow they’ll be going to Afghanistan and she still has to pack for herself and Tony.

summary:
*at the aquarium*
Tony: that fish over there reminds me of my dad
Stephen: why?
Tony: it’s just being really withholding
body:
*at the aquarium*

Tony: that fish over there reminds me of my dad

Stephen: why?

Tony: it’s just being really withholding

It was a lie, even a poor one for people who had known the Sorcerer for more than a couple of minutes, but Stark couldn’t deny that there was a certain kind of similarity between the two of them.
